This game has helped me with my patience IMMENSELY. I used to get so unreasonably frustrated at even the smallest of things. This all ranging from teammates urban evading in corners when they hear the slightest speck of a terror radius when playing survivor, to gens flying by and getting the good ol' butt dances from survivors after using the funny E button as killer (rip btw). After a while, I started to ask myself "is it really worth getting this worked up over this shit?". And so, I started taking breathers at the end of every game, and stopped stressing as hard over every single thing not going my way. Hell, started just not taking the game seriously and actually had more fun with it instead of acting like I was inclined to win every single match and oooh how dare the opposing team not do what I want them to do grrr. And shit man, it worked; I've grown more patient, understand what I do wrong and even change up how I approach matches mentally and physically.

TLDR: touched some grass instead of gens, pp doubled in size

Just like my Dwight, I have finally escaped this game. Something that I hated more times than I loved it, for every camping Bubba, tunnelling Bing Bong, every torch happy survivor, Im glad to be done.

But I did have a fun game every now and then - a clutch DS at the exit gate - now removed - or tricking a killer with the help of Spinechill - now a lot harder. Or even just having a fun killer or even more rare, survivors who weren't out to be more deadly than the killer. Or even just a Pig to boop the snoot with. The play with your friends made this game, the developers less so.

I'll recommend it, but I never ever plan to play this game again!

EDIT: Actually, no I won't. There are better games out there.

It was balanced before the update, but now it's not even fun anymore.  Killers were already OP but survivors could win. Now killers are gods and survivors have really no chance.

I gave it some more time to evaluate the game since the update:

I watched a developer live game play, just leisurely chasing survivors and mocking them as he hooked them... He showed no skill, meanwhile the survivors have to work so hard to stay alive. He laughed at the idea of survivors getting tunneled and acknowledged that it's probably going to happen more.

Killers have everything handed to them and can have a leisure time playing while the survivors can't. It takes no skill to be a killer but all the skill is in the survivor and the killers whine. the developers are pro killer and cater to their cries. It's not about the skill of a killer, for there is no real skill being one.

Boons are totally useless, since it takes time to find the totems and time to set up your boon. But the killer can just walk up to them and kick them with no real effort... Totems are easy to find by the killer, so if you want to lay boons, that's all your going to be doing for a great part of the game, gens are more important. Boon totems should take time for the killer to take out, not a single stomp and walk away.

I love challenges, before the update it was a fun challenge. Now it's not fun anymore, the challenge that mainly ends in your death, even being skilled, rarely wins anymore. It's no fun to have everything stacked against you, to the point that you're like a rat in a maze that does all it can to get out, you lose hope and give up.
this game genuine angers me but at the same time manages to bring me enjoyment somehow 10/10 would recommend

Don't even bother buying this game if you want to be a survivor main. Killers camp and tunnel more than ever before and the game has been made so easy for them now. They're faster and stronger, literally getting downed and hooked as soon as the game starts. Played 5 games and killer got 4k on each one. I tried dead hard and it couldn't have been made more pointless, timed it with the killers hit and still got downed. 0.5 sec endurance is pathetic! The game couldn't be more unbalanced. I've been playing this game for years but will be uninstalling it now. RIP DBD

Now they've finally managed it. With 900+ hours of playtime and always being very high ranked. I quit.

Playing a killer is just boring. The only chance to make a game interesting or maybe challenging is by going easy on survivors - chill out. You don't even have to know the killer's traits. Just some character control, game mechanics, 80% perks, 10% being a dick and you even get the points (like always).

Playing a survivor has not just become more and more challenging it's become frustrating. And it's not even the gameplay and perks. On average I would guess 7 out of 10 matches as a survivor end up with toxic like killers (a bit of player tunnel at the beginning of match, a little king of the hill) ... and nothing changes.

I really like challenges. Hey I really enjoy a good chase. But this game has become ridiculous, dull and frankly a waste of my time.

How the might fall from grace

From what I can tell this latest update completely ruined the game for me. Before the update I had most of the characters at level 40 which gives you the teachables for each of their 3 perks so other characters can learn them through the blood web. Now, you get all 3 perks from a character unlocked for every other character just by prestiging them (getting 50 levels) but only at level 1, in order to get level 3 for the perks you need to prestige them twice more for a total of 150 levels..... that's 110 levels more in order to unlock level 3 perks on all your characters and it's just absolutely ridiculous. For the experienced players that already had every DLC bought and all the characters unlocked this just means they'll need to do the 150 levels on all new DLC characters that are released but for us lowly mortals with less than 500-1000 hours played before this update we now need to get 110-150 levels on every single character, including the DLC ones that we may or may not own.

Unless they revert large portions of this update I really can't recommend this game to anyone. If you buy this game, which is already mostly filled with people who have played it for years and are far more experienced than you are, not only will you have to deal with the harsh learning curve, the crazy amount of DLC that you're strongly encouraged to buy just to have access to all the game content, and grinding out millions upon millions of blood points just to get to level 40 but now you need to do more than triple that just to get level 3 perks on the characters you actually care about playing.

Killers are way too buffed, and they just favored killers.  First of all, this is a TEAM game to escape the killer however, there are NO WAYS OF COMMUNICATION except discord if you play as a group.  Solo Queuing is a joke and you're least likely to survive.  There's no pinging or in-game communication.  Not only that, they buffed killers.  Killers already have their special abilities ontop of perks, they are faster and now to outrun a killer is impossible.  Youre only able to do a "360" skill to outrun them.  Theres no point of hiding in closets and you can be hit mid vault.  The pallets are also quicker to be broken down.  Not only that, survivors now have to take a longer time on generators however they need to stay there for 90 seconds because the regression rate is high especially when they hit it.

Killers benefits:
special abilities
faster running
pallet breaking faster
perks, not debuffed
generators regress faster, slower for survivors to fix

Survivors benefits:
5-15minutes of getting killed or fix generators.. and getting tunnelled or camped. :)
